text:
Reloadable is broken when webapplication is using a .jar file in the WEB-
INF/lib folder.

Tested using 05/08 build of TC4 using Sun's Java 1.3.0_02 under Win2Ksp1

How to test. Create tomcat\webapps\examples\WEB-INF\lib and stick any .jar file 
in there. Start Tomcat. Servlets will not reload when changed.
creator: david@i2a.com

text:
Currently, automatic class reloading is limited to unpacked classes under 
WEB-INF/classes.  There are some issues in getting the JDK to actually close old 
JAR files instead of caching them, which have to be worked around, to make it 
work for JAR files as well.

You can also use the manager web app to trigger reloads of an application at any 
time, whether or not you have set the "reloadable" attribute.
creator: craig.mcclanahan@sun.com

text: The bug has been fixed, and is a duplicate of 1739.
creator: remm@apache.org
